solution.text:
Rahul invested Rs. _{{8000*j}}_ into the bank \(\Rightarrow\) Pr = _{{8000*j}}_
Simple interest earned after 2 years = Rs _{{9*k*j*8000*Decimal('0.01')}}_ \(\Rightarrow\) N=2, Interest=_{{9*k*j*8000*Decimal('0.01')}}_
Let the rate of interest be R. Using simple interest formula, we get:
\(_{{9*k*j*8000*Decimal('0.01')}}_ = \frac{_{{8000*j}}_ \times 2 \times R}{100}\)
\( \Rightarrow R = \frac{_{{9*k*j*8000*Decimal('0.01')}}_ \times 100}{_{{8000*j}}_ \times 2} = _{{k*Decimal('4.5')}}_\)

content.text: Rahul put a sum of Rs _{{8000*j}}_ into the bank for _{k}_ years under the simple interest plan. At the end of 2 years, he earned Rs _{{9*k*j*8000*Decimal('0.01')}}_. What was the rate of interest ?
